thread.title: Samsung Z3 smartphone with Tizen OS launched in India priced at Rs 8,490
thread.title_full: Samsung Z3 smartphone with Tizen OS launched in India priced at Rs 8,490 | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: Samsung Z3 smartphone with Tizen OS launched in India priced at Rs 8,490
text:
Other Articles Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge+: There is a clear edge Ricoh Theta Camera: Your world is not flat InFocus M808 review: Inspiring design and display Samsung Z3 was launched in India on Monday at a price of Rs 8,490. An advanced Tizen-based smartphone, Z3 smartphone will be available online exclusively on Snapdeal and Samsung retail stores from October 21 in Gold, Black and Silver colour options.
Sporting a 5-inch HD resolution AMOLED display, 8 megapixel camera rear camera and 5 megapixel front camera, the Tizen Z3 comes preloaded with ‘My Galaxy’ app that offer consumers various deals on recharge, travel, movies, fashion etc and post purchase assistance.
Samsung Z3 runs on a 1.3 Ghz quad-core Spreadtrum processor and has 1GB RAM, 8 GB external memory that can be expanded up to 128GB. Other features include 2600 mAh battery and dual-SIM support. The smartphone however does not support 4G LTE.
“As a pioneer of Tizen platform, we have continuously introduced Tizen-based mobile devices, including Samsung Z1 and Samsung Gear S2, in our commitment to develop the Tizen ecosystem”, said JK Shin, CEO and Head of IT & Mobile Business at Samsung Electronics. “We developed the Samsung Z3 to provide the features that will help consumers capitalize on the growing Tizen ecosystem and make the most out of their personal mobile experience,” he added.
 14, 2015 5:31 pm © The Indian Express Online Media Pvt Ltd
